intro: Chrysosplenium yezoense var. atrodiscum, commonly known as the black disc chrysosplenium, is a perennial flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardiness. The species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
